comment.author: 74189138@N00
comment._content: Su nombre era Alfonso XIII de Borbón. Mas informacion en: es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alfonso_XIII_de_Espa%c3%b1a

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Alfonso was in the news in November, 1913, when the jaunty monarch played host in Madrid to Raymond Poincare, President of France, whom he had visited in Paris several months earlier. Perhaps the Bain News Agency circulated this photo of Alfonso at that time.

Alfonso and Poincare:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4465089440/]

comment.author: 38789304@N06
comment._content:
Bonita fotofrafia del Rey Alfonso XIII, (q,e,p,d,), creo con el uniforme
de Coronel de los Hùsares de la Reina.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Everyone,

Thanks for the more complete identification of King Alfonso XIII. We will add it to the record when we update.

comment.author: 41281237@N04
comment._content: Looks like a bit of a fop!

comment.author: 36645048@N00
comment._content: Since he is wearing the uniform of an Hungarian Hussar Regiment and the sash and star of the Hungarian order of St Stephen this probably commemorates a state visit to the Austro-Hungarian Empire. The medals are worn "Austrian style" too.
